website_summaries.verdict: The Kyocera Event is a great price for a smartphone on Virgin Mobile, but a lot has been sacrificed to reach it.

customer_reviews.title: Quality Matches the Price Tag: Not a good Low-End Smartphone model
customer_reviews.text: Not a suitable smartphone. Contains the software necessary to download smartphone apps and make data connections, but does not possess the RAM necessary to properly run any apps. Would recommend LG Volt or models of equivalent caliber and price range. I have tried the Event and other similar Virgin Mobile models - smartphone analogs sold at prices less that $100. All were disappointing in similar ways: an evident compromise made between providing the expected functionality of a smartphone, while being forced to include low-quality software/hardware in order to sell the device in a lower price range. Not worth the money saved. Make a $50-80 greater investment; those phones will be the perfect Low-End Smartphone you're seeking.
customer_reviews.author: Naglfarslayer

customer_reviews.title: This is the worst phone I have EVER bought
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst phone I have EVER bought. I have a been a customer of Virgin Mobile since about 2004. I'm talking flip phone, top up card, Virgin Mobile. Those phones weren't the greatest but they did what they were designed to do. Now that I'm about ten years into it, I know phones. I know Virgin Mobile phones--and this Kyocera Event is by far the worst phone they've ever had!
customer_reviews.author: Literally Black

customer_reviews.title: Solid phone.
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent little phone that I bought for a great price around Black Friday. I bought it for my 4yo son to play with (Angry Birds, taking pictures, watching movies, etc), and it's great for that. The only huge disadvantage is that it's difficult and risky to root this phone, and there are no custom roms or software upgrades available because the bootloader is locked tight. Kyocera will not release access, because it is against their agreements with the service providers. In other words, if you don't want to do anything other than use it as shipped and get apps from Google Play, it's perfect. If you enjoy tinkering with your phone, this is not for you.
customer_reviews.author: John Q Public

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this phone
customer_reviews.text: This phone is one of the worst phones I've ever owned! The processor is painfully slow it randomly crashes app's sometimes without even a error message there is times when the phone won't recognize the on-screen keyboard also the phone will randomly restart itself. The battery life is horrible the only good thing i can say about this phone is the case is made well. My advice to you is if you can afford a better smartphone then please forget about this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Jpaul

customer_reviews.title: Nice phone, Bad Camera
customer_reviews.text: While i would not recommend this phone to someone who wants a top performing android i would however recommend this to someone who NEEDS a smartphone for simple use. Other people say the battery dies quickly and it restarts often but that doesn't seem to be the case with me at all as mine runs smoothly. I originally bought this phone for the camera so I could deposit my checks. I was told it had auto focus (which was a lie) but I was still able to take good enough pictures of my checks for them to deposit (YOU NEED ADEQUATE SUNLIGHT FOR THIS TO WORK!!!) Other than that i have no problems with the phone....for now.
customer_reviews.author: URC

customer_reviews.title: It works fine as a low-cost smart wi-fi mobile device which is what I bought it for
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Kyocera Event Android Phone because I wanted a portable Android wifi capable device to run a few apps. I don't really care about the device as a cell phone and I haven't activated it. I use it to run a few apps, including the LEAF Spy app for looking at the battery stats on my Nissan LEAF. Battery Life could be better, but if you disable the power hungry features, it seems to hold the charge a bit better.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Fontana

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Gift
customer_reviews.text: This was an appreciation gift to my father. After a few days, this phone became more of a disappointing nuisance than anything else. This phone is less than average, more battery problems than anyone should have to deal with, constantly locking, the camera is poor quality, calls are consistently dropped, and the list can go on. He's highly upset at this device and will be replacing it with something else very soon.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Best choice for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is an Android phone that does almost everything a much more expensive smart phone will do. It has the built in GPS and voice services and is very user friendly and easy to set up and navigate. After the initial expense of the phone, you can choose a monthly plan starting as low as $25. Get rid of your contract and try pay as you go! Put money in your own pocket. :o)
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Had great luck with this for MP3 or Audiobooks
customer_reviews.text: Had great luck with this for MP3 or Audiobooks! put a 32 SD card in and with the 16 g that is already there you are set. I have over 120 audiobooks along with music etc. and it still has lots of storage left. Most of all it is mobile use it on wi-fi and it will hook to anything! at a much lower price than I-Pod,
customer_reviews.author: rlnewk

customer_reviews.title: It may not work for Assurance Wireless plans
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use this on my assurance wireless plan, thought the reviews said it could work on it, but Virgin mobile says NOT. I will keep it for a great little "tablet" for games, surfing, and music. Might eventually switch plans to use as an actual phone. Great touch screen, and easy connection to the computer for downloading stuff.
customer_reviews.author: S Jacobi

customer_reviews.title: unreliable, not sure if it is hardware issue or just insufficient specs for the OS to run stable.
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was a good deal at first as it did everything I wanted it to, but after a few months it started rebooting at random, after about 6 months the reboots became frequent. Now after replacing the phone I've tried doing factory resets and it is usable but only if I don't install apps, after installing a few apps it goes back to random reboots again.
customer_reviews.author: dhanson865

customer_reviews.title: basic very cheap entry
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son to use while his phone was being repaired. It's cheap and it gets the job done. Not a phone most people would want to install a bunch of apps on or anything, but for a basic very cheap entry, sure, it works. LOVE Virgin Mobile service.
customer_reviews.author: OHmom

customer_reviews.title: pretty okay for the price!
customer_reviews.text: i brought this phone knowing the camera wasnt the greatest, so no surprise there. the camera is nice in great daylight but during the night time forget it. phone freezes and has to turned off and on like once a week, and the apps open really slow. im still debating if its the phone itself ot the sucky virgin mobile service that explains why it takes forever for the browser to load :/
customer_reviews.author: Beth Warren

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money!
customer_reviews.text: The Battery drains to fast and their to much loaded on it, and you cant uninstall any of the apps loaded on it. that make the battery drain fast. it gets hot when your using it to long. I wont buy this cell ever again. worst cell virgin Mobil has made! not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: BookWormMary

customer_reviews.title: My flip phone broke and I thought I would enter the world of smart phones on the cheap with the Kyocera
customer_reviews.text: . My flip phone broke and I thought I would enter the world of smart phones on the cheap with the Kyocera. Big mistake. This phone failed to perform its most basic function. When I made calls on this piece of junk no one could hear me, like literally. I had to repeat things three and four times. I returned the phone for a replacement and had the same problem. I was disappointed because I had great luck with other Kyocera phones in the past.
customer_reviews.author: stdennis

customer_reviews.title: its cheap, not even good temporary phone.

customer_reviews.author: Anthony Carrasco

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. The screen was all scratched up. And had a lot of wear and tear but that is my fault because I didn't read everything about the phone. And hey 20.00 for a touch screen phone is a steal. Just read everything about the phone and you can find a really good used one in great condition.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Phone
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these phones for my teenage daughters. Both phones were not working well from the very beginning. They would turn on and off at random. I contacted Virgin Mobile who graciously replaced the phones. Those phones didn't work either. Virgin Mobile sent replacements for my daughters two more times. So, in all had 8 of these phones and none of them worked properly. Virgin Mobile even offered to replace them again but at this point I gave up on the phones and called it a lost! I was impressed with Virgin Mobile for replacing and trying so many times especially since I didn't buy the phone thru them. However, would never buy a Virgin Mobile phone.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Dont Buy
customer_reviews.text: This phone itself is just one BIG glitch after another. Even the replacement phone that was sent to replace this one was refurbished & was a piece of junk. The phone won't even stay on its glitches so much it keeps restarting itself for some reason smh.

customer_reviews.text: Horrible said that it was compatible with my current service which it was not total waste of money. Unavailable in South Florida for network service.

This little gem is perfect. I'm very happy with my choice and recommend it to anyone who can't see, or is over age 60, whichever comes first.

customer_reviews.text: keep heaving to restart it so no not happy with this phone at all need to be off market for good

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS!
customer_reviews.text: This phone is NOT the best choice out there. You literally get what you pay for. I bought it thinking it would be a good little work phone. I have never been more wrong in my life. This phone turns off and on all by itself. It barely gets reception ANYWHERE. I'm a little surprised that Virgin Mobile is still in business. I sent the phone back with the whole month of service still on it. NOT IMPRESSED AT ALL!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY I REPEAT PLEASE DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DID NOT WORK! Never did, since bought it always turned off.
customer_reviews.text: Very poor. Took it literally 25 minutes to turn on. Always turned off. One month and then it broke. Slow and dumb.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Sent it back.
customer_reviews.text: Felt very cheaply built. Battery life was dismal, maybe 5 hours with little use. Issues connecting to internet. Just before I decided to send it back, the screen stated going black and took a few seconds to get it to respond again. Only had for 2 weeks before sending back. Would not recommend Virgin Mobile or this phone. Nice customer service, but don't know how to do anything but work off scripts.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: very slo
customer_reviews.text: this phone gets very slow, once too many apps installed sadly, i want a refund, and this is not what i expected
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

product_meta.title: Kyocera Event Prepaid Android Phone (Virgin Mobile)
product_meta.description:
Stay connected with this Virgin Mobile Kyocera Event cell phone, which features 3G speed and Wi-Fi capability for quick access to the Web. The Android 4.0 Ice Cream Sandwich operating system and touch screen ensure a high level of usability.

AMAZON.COM


Experience the best features of Android with the Kyocera Event. This 3G device combines a speedy 1GHz single-core processor, 3.5-inch touchscreen display, and 3.2 megapixel camera in a convenient prepaid package by Virgin Mobile.

The Event runs on 4.0 Ice Cream Sandwich out of the box, so you can start browsing the Web instantly on Android's powerful operating system. Message and email on a virtual QWERTY keypad with intuitive Swype technology. View pictures and video on the Event's large 3.5-inch display, or take your own with the LED flash-enabled camera and video camcorder. If you want more, this prepaid device gives you access to the Google Play store, where you can choose from thousands of the latest Android applications and multimedia. The Kyocera Event is also Bluetooth 2.1 compatible and microSD card enabled for enhanced call quality and memory storage.

PHONE SPECIFICATIONS
 * 1 GHz Qualcomm Snapdragon processor
 * Memory: 512 MB RAM; 4 GB ROM
 * External Memory: up to 32 GB microSD card
 * Resolution: HVGA, 480 x 320 pixels
 * Talk Time: 522 minutes (8.7 hours)

WHAT'S INCLUDED:
 * Kyocera C5133 Handset
 * 1500 mAh Li-Ion Battery
 * Micro USB Cable with Charger
 * MicroSD Card NOT INCLUDED
feature_bullets: 3.2 MP Camera with LED Flash and Video
